docs.title: AWS Boto3 to Terraform CLI Tool
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation site for the AWS Boto3 to Terraform CLI.

docs.title: This tool lets you:
docs.text:
• Discover AWS VPCs and EC2 instances
  • Generate Terraform .tf files from live AWS environments
  • Easily reverse-engineer infrastructure into code

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• AWS region selection
  • VPC and EC2 discovery
  • Terraform config generation
  • Modular Python structure
  • Auto-generated documentation using MkDocs

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
python main.py

Enter your AWS region, and the tool will generate terraform_output/vpcs.tf.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
pip install -r requirements.txt

Ensure your AWS credentials are configured locally.

docs.title: Running the Tool
docs.text:
python main.py

You’ll be prompted to enter an AWS region (e.g. us-east-1). The tool will generate a Terraform .tf file in the terraform_output/ folder.

docs.title: utils.aws_fetch
docs.text:
aws_fetch.py

Contains utility functions that use Boto3 to list AWS VPCs and EC2 instances. Used by the CLI tool to generate Terraform configs.
